intro: Zephyranthes mesochloa f. rosea, commonly known as the roseate rain lily, is a striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. This flowering plant is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in parts of Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its elegant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a subtle rose hue. The plant produces its blooms during the rainy season, typically in the spring or early summer. Its foliage consists of strap-like leaves that are narrow and grass-like, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens and landscapes.
